description.narrative:
Oxfam Novib's Strategic Partnership (SP) with the Dutch government and more specifically the Theory of Change for Finance for Development (F4D) is operational in many countries.
In Finance for Development, Oxfam Novib and SOMO aim to achieve that morewomen, youth and other citizens benefit from higher quality and quantity of finance for development, an enhanced fiscal system and a sustainable and inclusive financial and corporate sector, tackling extreme inequality.
To achieve the long-term outcomeof the project, we usethe following strategies: capacity building of civil society organizations, strengthening national and international coalitions, increase public pressure on governments and multinational corporations, increased media coverage, and increased political will.
Within the Fair Tax Monitor Bangladesh project the following activities have been identified: Support tax campaigning in Bangladesh. In specific, the support will go to SUPRO (Campaign for Good Governance), a network organisations which unites over 600 CSOs/NGOs and isactive in 45 out of 64 districts in Bangladesh. SUPRO campaigns for participatory budget and accountable and transparent public financing. The support is coordinated with the Oxfam Bangladesh office, and will focus on grass root participation, mass awareness campaigns and in developing linkages between regional and national tax movements. Moreover, the support will allow SUPRO to stay part ofthe Fair Tax Monitor. Our work in Bangladesh is an example for the workwe are developing in other SP countries.

participating-org.narrative:
Oxfam has been present in Bangladesh for 42 years, and has been extending assistance to its people through various other organisations as early as 1954.
Under one programme approach, Oxfam aims to create an environment containing empowered, resilient communitieswhere women and men contribute jointly to good governance and leadership across Bangladesh.
With this vision, all the work in Bangladesh falls under two strategic lenses, Women#s Leadership and Resilient Communities and four Country Change Objectives: 1.More women in Bangladesh will be free to make decisions concerning themselves, their families, their community and their country. They will be empowered to do this through their realization of their rights, their control of resources, theirfreedom from violence, and theiraccess to and influence within social and political space. 2.The quality of education for all is enhanced and more girls and young women will have access to quality education enabling them to fully participate in life andsociety and claim their rights. 3.The mostmarginalised women, men, girls and boys have increased food and income security through increased resilience of their communities and livelihoods to change and disaster. 4.Vulnerable communities, government andhumanitarian actors will be prepared for, and able tocope and adapt to shocks, resulting in reduced negative impact, more rapid and effective response, and more rapid recovery.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation

description.narrative: Increased political will: # cases of influentials endorsing gender sensitive policy asks of Oxfam/partners for tax transparency & ensuring that corporate taxes are paid where real exonomic activity takes place & private wealth cannot be hidden offshore.
